revision.text:
{{Infobox video game |title = JASF: Jane's Advanced Strike Fighters |image = |developer = [[Trickstar Games]] |publisher = Maximum Family Games |series = ''[[Jane's Combat Simulations]]'' |engine = |platforms = [[Microsoft Windows]], [[Xbox 360]], [[PlayStation 3]] |released = October 18, 2011 |genre = [[Combat flight simulator]] |modes = }} '''''JASF: Jane's Advanced Strike Fighters''''' is an arcade styled flight simulator developed by Trickstar Games and published by Maximum Family Games.<ref name=gamespot>{{cite web|title=JASF: Jane's Advanced Strike Fighters Tech Info|url=http://www.gamespot.com/jasf-janes-advanced-strike-fighters/techinfo/|publisher=GameSpot|accessdate=19 March 2012}}</ref> Released in October 2011,<ref name=gamespot/> it was the first game to have the ''Jane's'' title in over a decade.{{citation needed|date=March 2012}} Unlike the previous games in the ''[[Jane's Combat Simulations]]'' line, ''JASF'' does not feature realistic gameplay and instead focuses more on arcade-style action.<ref name=oxm>{{cite web|title=J.A.S.F.: Jane's Advanced Strike Fighters review|url=http://www.oxmonline.com/jasf-janes-advanced-strike-fighters-review|publisher=Official Xbox Magazine|accessdate=20 March 2013}}</ref>
== Story == For ten long years, the small island nation of Azbaristan has been rent by a disastrous civil war. Two factions of the government―the Northern People's Republic of Azbaristan and the Southern Azbaristan Democratic Front―have fought over resources and thousands have died in the struggle. When the cease-fire was negotiated, the North controlled everything except the Southern capital city of Talvade. Knowing that the North's fiery leader, Chairman Kropanin Borzai, could order his forces to resume the war at any moment, the SADF wasted no time in petitioning the Western Democratic Alliance in a desperate plea for support. In exchange for exclusive trade rights to South Azbaristan's vast oil and natural gas reserves, the WDA sent help in the form of military advisors and hardware.
One exceptional individual is a fighter pilot known only by his callsign, Razor, who served in the Second Gulf War and the War on Terror and has extensive experience in both air-to-air and air-to-ground operations with almost any fixed-wing combat aircraft. The skill and ability of this one pilot rivals that of an entire squadron, North or South, and can hold his own even when outnumbered ten to one.
There are fifteen combat aircraft of four profiles to choose from―ground attack, multirole, fighter and air superiority―each with two versions. They're divided by generation and range from classics like the F-4 Phantom II and MiG-21 Fishbed to the most advanced stealth aircraft like the F-22 Raptor and Su-50 PAK-FA, armed with a variety of air-to-air and air-to-ground munitions. Some are more specialized to one mission profile than others, with armament weighted toward that specialization, but all carry a cannon.
==Reception== When Trickstar Studios and Maximum Family Games announced the release of JASF, hopes were high for the game's reception. The air combat flight simulation craze was at its peak and games of the theme were experiencing record sales. The ''[[Ace Combat]]'' series was ultra-popular, the ''Blazing Angels'' were getting older but still maintaining a fan base among historical fiction nuts and Tom Clancy's ''[[Tom Clancy's H.A.W.X|HAWX]]'' games were on the rise. It was assumed that this one was destined to take its place in the air combat flight simulator community.
The game garnered a mixed reaction from the players, however. While the graphics were impressive, the game was plagued by a weak storyline, jumpy mechanics, a repetitive score, poor AI and some very frustrating rendering issues. It also lacked a choice mechanic, which applied rewards and consequences to choices the player made in-game. This made the experience very linear and locked players in a brain-melting "same-darn-thing-every-time" routine. With these shortcomings, the game experienced a brief life and met an abrupt end.
Reviews on aggregator [[Metacritic]] have been generally negative and below 50 points.<ref name="meta">{{cite web|title=JASF: Jane's Advanced Strike Fighters Xbox 360|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/jasf-janes-advanced-strike-fighters/critic-reviews|publisher=Metacritic.com|accessdate=19 March 2012}}</ref>

''[[Justice Bao (2010 TV series)|Justice Bao]]'' (2010–) |website = |production_website = }} {{Infobox Chinese|title=Justice Bao|c={{linktext|包|青|天}}|p=Bāo Qīng Tiān|w=Pao1 Ch'ing1 T'ien1|j=Baau1 Cing1 Tin1}} '''''Justice Pao''''' is a 236-episode television series from [[Taiwan]], first airing on [[Chinese Television System]] (CTS) from February 1993 to January 1994. ==Background== The show stars [[Jin Chao-chun]] as the legendary [[Song dynasty]] official [[Bao Zheng]]. It was hugely popular in many countries in East Asia and Southeast Asia. The series was originally scheduled for just 15 episodes. However, the show garnered high ratings when the initial episodes aired. Due to its popularity, CTS expanded the show to 236 episodes. The [[TVB]] and [[ATV Home]] networks in Hong Kong both bought the series in an attempt to gain viewers. Competition between the two networks during the showing of the series was so severe that identical episodes were shown on both channels on the same night. It was also one of the first dramas that used [[NICAM]] technology ([[Second audio program|Dual Sound Switch]] Cantonese/Mandarin). ==List of cases== {| class="wikitable" |- !style="background-color: #00BFFF" width="20" | Case !style="background-color: #00BFFF" | ep.

Song Dynasty general, Princess Di's nephew |} ==Awards== 1995 – '''30th [[Golden Bell Awards]]'''{{cite web|publisher=[[Government Information Office]] |date=April 20, 2004 |script-title=zh:84年金鐘獎得獎名單【個人技術纇/其他獎】 |url=http://info.gio.gov.tw/ct.asp?xItem=13330&ctNode=1983 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120713044831/http://info.gio.gov.tw/ct.asp?xItem=13330&ctNode=1983 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 13, 2012 |accessdate=2012-04-12 |language=Chinese }} * '''Won''' – [[Jin Chao-chun]], [[Golden Bell Award for Best Actor|Best Actor]] * '''Won''' – Tai Chih-yuan, [[Golden Bell Award for Best Supporting Actor|Best Supporting Actor]], for the portrayal of Guo Huai (Case 3) * '''Won''' – Liu Ming, [[Golden Bell Award for Best Supporting Actress|Best Supporting Actress]], for the portrayal of Bao Mian's mother (Case 8) ==Theme songs== 1. The opening theme, performed by Hu Kua, has the same title as the series. It was originally performed by Chiang Kuang-Chao for the earlier 1974 CTS series also of the same name. * A [[Cantonese]] [[cover version|cover]] ("願世間有青天") performed by [[George Lam]] with lyrics by [[Wong Jim]] was the opening theme of the series on [[TVB]] in Hong Kong. It was also the opening theme of the 1995 TVB series ''Justice Bao''. * Another Cantonese cover by [[Ray Lui]] was the opening theme of the 1995 [[Asia Television|ATV]] series ''Justice Bao''. * A [[Tagalog language|Tagalog]] [[cover version|cover]] ("Judge Bao") was the opening theme of the series on [[TV5 (Philippines)|ABC-5]] in [[the Philippines]]. * [[Andy Lau]] covered the song in the 2003 Bao Zheng-related movie ''[[Cat and Mouse (2003 film)|Cat and Mouse]]''. 2. The ending theme was "New Dream of the Butterfly Lovers" ({{zh|c=新鴛鴦蝴蝶夢 |p = Xīn Yuānyāng Húdié Mèng}}), written and performed by [[Huang An (singer)|Huang An]]. * This song became a huge hit in the Chinese-speaking world, and Huang's album with the same name became one of the [[List of best-selling albums in Taiwan|best-selling albums in Taiwan]], selling over a million copies. * Cover versions in many languages exist due to the show's influence in the region. [[Kenny Ho]] recorded a [[Cantonese]] version (also "新鴛鴦蝴蝶夢") with lyrics by [[Albert Leung]], while Huang An and [[Loletta Lee]] each recorded a different Cantonese version (both titled "愛於錯誤年代" but the lyrics differ). A popular English version from the Singaporean band Tokyo Square was titled "Can't Let Go". Huang An's own English version was titled "When It Comes to Love". There are also versions in [[Hokkien]] ("鴛鴦蝴蝶夢" by Joice Lim), [[Thai language|Thai]] ("สุดจะหยุดใจ" by Koong Tuangsith Reamchinda), [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] ("Uyên Ương Hồ Điệp Mộng" by Dan Truong), [[Khmer language|Khmer]] ("ផ្ការោយមុនរដូវ" by Nou Sib and "ព្រួយ ជាមួយ ចន្ទ" by Khemarak Sereymon) and [[Indonesian language|Indonesian]] ("Melody Memory" by Lavenia), among others. 3. Another ending theme song used for some episodes was "Xiéshŏu Yóu Rénjiān" ({{zh|c=攜手遊人間|l=Traveling the World Hand in Hand}}). ==International broadcast== It first aired in Singapore on the [[MediaCorp TV Channel 12|Channel 12]] (now [[MediaCorp TV12 Suria|Suria]]) a member of [[MediaCorp TV12|Singapore Television Twelve (STV12)]] (now [[MediaCorp TV12]]) was launched on October 3, 1994 with [[Malay language|Malay]] [[dubbing (filmmaking)|dubbing]] at 20:30 [[Singapore Standard Time|SST]] after [[News|Berita 12]] programme. In [[Thailand]] first aired on [[Channel 3 (Thailand)|Channel 3]] on 1995, with reruns on same channel beginning October 1, 2015.{{cite web|title=เปาบุ้นจิ้น1993 เริ่ม 1 ต.ค. ช่อง3, ช่อง3HD|url=http://www.jomyut.club/index.php/news-update/series-in-thai/item/192-justice-bao-1993|work=jomyut.club|accessdate=December 12, 2015|date=September 10, 2015|language=thai}} *{{flagicon|Myanmar}}[[Myanmar Radio and Television]] == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * {{IMDb title|1501313|Bao Qing Tian}} {{The Seven Heroes and Five Gallants}} [[Category:Fictional depictions of Bao Zheng in television]] [[Category:1993 Taiwanese television series debuts]] [[Category:1994 Taiwanese television series endings]] [[Category:Taiwanese wuxia television series]] [[Category:Fantasy television series]] [[Category:Ghosts in television]] [[Category:Demons in television]] [[Category:Crime drama]] [[Category:Television shows set in Kaifeng]]

{{for|the film|The Leading Man}} {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} [[File:Clark Gable - publicity.JPG|thumb|right|American actor [[Clark Gable]] was a leading man in over 60 major [[Cinema of the United States|Hollywood]] productions. ]] A l'''eading man''' is the [[actor]] who is the protagonist or plays a [[love interest]] to the [[leading actress]] in a film or play. A leading man is sometimes an all-rounder; capable of singing, dancing, and acting at a professional level.
A leading man can also be an actor who is often seen in romantic roles. An example of this would be [[Bruce Cabot]]'s role in ''[[King Kong (1933 film)|King Kong]]''. Less frequently, the epithet has been applied to an actor who is often associated with one particular actress; for example, [[Spencer Tracy]] had a similar association with [[Katharine Hepburn]]. However, used in this sense, the woman is usually described as the ''[[leading lady]]'' of the man. The term is also used collectively, as in "[[Hollywood]]'s leading men" to refer to a group of notable, famous, or popular actors.
== Examples ==
=== 1920s === Leading men of the silent era included [[Francis X Bushman]], [[J. Warren Kerrigan]], [[Douglas Fairbanks]], [[Charlie Chaplin]], [[Sessue Hayakawa]], [[Wallace Reid]], [[Richard Barthelmess]], [[Lon Chaney]], [[Ramon Novarro]], [[John Barrymore]], [[Thomas Meighan]], [[Rudolph Valentino]] and [[Milton Sills]].
=== 1930s === Leading men of the 1930s included [[Clark Gable]], [[Ronald Colman]], [[Maurice Chevalier]], [[Warren William]], [[John Boles (actor)|John Boles]], [[William Powell]], [[Fredric March]], [[Gary Cooper]], [[Edward G. Robinson]], [[Cary Grant]], [[Frank Morgan]], [[Robert Montgomery (actor)|Robert Montgomery]], [[Bing Crosby]], [[James Cagney]], [[Errol Flynn]], [[Franchot Tone]], [[George Brent]], [[Robert Taylor (actor)|Robert Taylor]], and [[Charles Boyer]].
=== 1940s === In the 1940s, leading men included [[James Stewart]], [[Humphrey Bogart]], [[Tyrone Power]], [[John Wayne]], [[Joel McCrea]], [[Ray Milland]], [[Ronald Reagan]], [[Bob Hope]], [[Dana Andrews]], [[Joseph Cotten]], [[Gregory Peck]], [[William Holden]], [[Burgess Meredith]], [[Burt Lancaster]], [[Victor Mature]], and [[Robert Mitchum]].
=== 1950s === The 1950s included [[Kirk Douglas]], [[Gene Kelly]], [[Montgomery Clift]], [[Rock Hudson]], [[Tony Curtis]], [[Ricardo Montalban]], [[Jeff Chandler]], [[Marlon Brando]], [[Yul Brynner]], [[Ronald Howard (British actor)|Ronald Howard]], [[James Dean]], [[Frank Sinatra]], [[Dean Martin]], [[Jack Lemmon]], and [[Paul Newman]].
=== Contemporary === Some examples of modern-day leading men include [[Chris Pratt]], [[Ben Affleck]], [[George Clooney]], [[Sylvester Stallone]],[[Brad Pitt]], [[Johnny Depp]], [[Tom Cruise]], [[Leonardo DiCaprio]], [[Christian Bale]], [[Will Smith]], [[Matt Damon]], [[James Franco]], [[Samuel L. Jackson]], [[Ryan Reynolds]], [[Denzel Washington]], [[Matthew McConaughey]], [[Heath Ledger]], [[Bradley Cooper]], [[Hugh Jackman]], [[Tom Hardy]], and [[Jake Gyllenhaal]].{{Citation needed|date=February 2016 }}
==See also== *[[Character actor]] *[[Movie star]] *[[Supporting actor]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Leading Man}} [[Category:Acting]]

revision.text:
{{More citations needed|date=August 2012}} '''Marathi Keertan''' Or " Kirtan " is an art of spiritual teaching through [[story-telling]]. It is typically performed by one or two main performers, called '''Keertankar''', accompanied by [[Pump organ|Harmonium]] and [[Tabla]] musicians. It involves singing, acting, dancing, and story-telling, However it is unlike any other performing art as it is basically pure glorification of god and godly acts.<ref> {{cite book | last = Dixit | first = Durga | title = Diamond Maharashtra Sankritikosh (Marathi: डायमंड महाराष्ट्र संस्कृतीकोश) | publisher = Diamond Publications | location = [[Pune, India]] | year = 2009 | page = 166 | isbn = 978-81-8483-080-4 }} </ref><ref> {{cite book | last = Varadpande | first = Manohar Laxman | title = History of Indian Theatre | url = https://books.google.com/?id=6ZrjC24PuDQC&lpg=PA95&dq=keertan&pg=PA96#v=onepage&q=keertan&f=false | publisher = Abhinav Publications | volume = 2 | year = 1992 | page = 95 | isbn = 9788170172789 }} </ref> <ref>{{cite book | last = Arnett | first = Robert | title = India Unveiled | publisher = Atman Press | location = [[Columbus, Georgia]] U.S A. | year = 2006 | page = 53 | edition = Fifth | isbn = 978-0-9652900-4-3 }} </ref>
Based on the format and subjects, Keertan / Kirtan has been classified into several types, described in the sections below.
== Origin == In Indian mythology the story of [[Prahlad|Bhakta Prahlad]] is famous for the uninterrupted devotion of a small child towards the almighty God, despite the obstacles created by his own father demon Hiranyakashipu. In the same "Avatar katha" child Prahlad the heavenly prince defines 9 types of "Bhakti" devotion. The relevant shloka <ref> {{cite book | last1 = Kelkar | first1 = M. | last2 = Mahabal | first2 = K. | title = Keertanrang (Marathi: कीर्तनरंग) | publisher = Akhil Bharatiya Keertan Sanstha | location = Dadar, Mumbai, India | year = 2007 | page = 1 }}</ref> says,
<poem> Shrawanam keertanam vishnoh smaranam padsevanam | Archanam vandanam dasyam sakhyam atmanivedanam || </poem>
Meaning -There are 9 types (stages) of "Bhakti" or ways of devotion. # Shravanam- Hearing stories of the god or heavenly virtues. # Keertanam- Admire and sing the songs of god and goodness. # Smaranam- Remembering god and goodness. # Paad sevanam- Offering services to Godly places and godly work. # Archanam- Performing pooja or offering decorations and comforts to god and good people. # Vandanam- Respects feet of the almighty. # Daasyam- Selfless and uninterrupted services to god. # Sakhyam- Making friendship with god,without material expectations. # Atmanivedanam- Offering one's everything to god without leaving back anything.
The second type namely, "Keertan or Kirtan" as is called is performing art of presenting sayings from old good books and mythological literature along with a tint of music, dance, humor, etc. Due to scarce means of transport and communications, the performers called Keertankars use to travel a lot. Town to town and place to place over long periods and offer performances so as to enlighten the people. All over India this form of devotion is still live and prevalent in one form or another. All states have Keertans in Temples, Gurudwaras, mandirs and holy festival places too.
Keertan is also called Hari Keertan, Katha or Harikatha, Sankirtan, Nam sankeertan, etc. Keertan carries a tradition as old as times of age old muni Narada the best devotee of lord [[Vishnu]]. Naradiya keertan follows a format that is named after [[Narada]] the sacred son of Brahmadev or lord [[Brahma]] .<ref> {{cite book | last1 = Hate | first1 = Narendrabuwa | last2 = Koparkar | first2 = G. N. | title = Keertanachi Prayog Prakriya (Marathi: कीर्तनाची प्रयोग प्रक्रिया) | publisher = Keertan Mahavidyalaya Prakashan | location = Pune, India | year = 1982 | page = 4 }} </ref>
== Naradiya Keertan ==
or "Naradiya Kirtan" an age old form of devotion,admire of gods and godly acts,glorification of the almighty,and also a tool used by the performers to keep people updated on the world out of their towns and also to educate the masses about good values of life and very purpose of human life,thru a medium of "ONE MAN SHOW" consisting of prose and musical performance given at the temples and other holy places.<ref>{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.co.in/books?id=8qMlCgAAQBAJ&printsec=frontcover#v=onepage&q&f=false|title=This Thing Called Music: Essays in Honor of Bruno Nettl|last=Levine|first=Victoria Lindsay|last2=Bohlman|first2=Philip V.|date=2015-05-21|publisher=Rowman & Littlefield|year=|isbn=9781442242081|location=|pages=56|language=en}}</ref>
=== Structure === In this format Keertan is divided into 5 parts ,<ref> {{cite book | last = Koparkar | first = G. N. | title = Katha Haridasaanchi (Marathi: कथा हरिदासांची) | publisher = Keertan Mahavidyalaya Prakashan | location = [[Pune, India]] | year = 2000 | page = 2}}</ref> # Naman or prayer # Main spiritual and philosophical lesson called "Purvaranga" (First of the two major part)based on old epics. # Chanting the holy name of god,in between. # A story suitable to support the spiritual teaching in first half called "katha or Akhyan" (Second of the two major parts) # Final prayer for universal welfare and well being of people.
It lasts for period of any length, ideally for half an hour to 3 hours at a stretch.
=== Dress code ===
==== Gentlemen ==== There are no hard and fast written rules,and different dress codes are prevalent in different geographic and social environments. However, by convention and as an age old practice and tradition, men wear
# White 9 yards cotton clothing [[dhoti]].(performers of Ramdasi keertankars prefer clothing in saffron colour.) # Knee long [[kurta]] with full sleeves, often called "Barabandi (that apparel has no buttons but 12 tags to tie or top called Zabba that is very common during festive occasions" # A white or colored turban or "[[Puneri Pagadi]]" (a special crownlike decorative traditional head gear that is a cap, usually in saffron color) on the head. # A 2 yard long colored "uttareeya or uparane "hanging on shoulders. # The performer stands barefoot on a special mattress.musician with harmonium at his left and tabala on his right side. # Fresh flower garland. # Red or saffron kumkum or sandlewood tilak [[tilak]] on his forehead.(sometimes black colored "Bukka" also preferred especially by those practicing " varkari keertan".)
==== Ladies ====
# Usually wear the traditional Indian 6 yards or 9 yards saree. # Traditional ornaments including ear rings,bracelets or bangles,Necklace,nose rings of different decors. # fresh flower Garland, flowers decorating hair too.) # Red Kumkum [[tilak]] on forehead.
The performer has accomplishment of musical instruments like harmonium, drums and string instruments of various types mostly "Zanz","chipali", "Tal" or "Chimata".Performer needs to study a lot of things in literature, music dance, humor and acting. He has to be a good orator and able debating artist. Usually the subjects are full of devotion, sacrifice, kindness, bravery, values of life, extinguishing ills of life, personal development of each individual physically and spiritually.
A lot of reading, practice of debating, musical training, sound memory and all round knowledge only can make a good performer in Keertan. But after all,the main cause and purpose of Keertan is "glorification of god and godly acts"
=== Training ===
The main institute for training is "Keertan Kul", with office situated at Sangli and the "Shankaracharya of Karaveer Peeth " as Chair person. There are some institutes offering the training in Keertan apart from individual schools and coaching classes in small towns all over India.
Marathi Naradiya keertan is taught at the following locations in its formal traditional way: # Akhil Bharatiya Keertan Sanstha at Dadar, Mumbai<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://keertansanstha.in/itihaas/|title=इतिहास {{!}} अखिल भारतीय कीर्तन संस्था|last=|first=|date=|website=keertansanstha.in|language=mr|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-30}}</ref> # Narad Mandir at Sadashiv Peth, Pune # Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University at Ramtek, Nagpur<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://kksanskrituni.digitaluniversity.ac/Content.aspx?ID=872|title=Kavikulaguru Kalidas Sanskrit University|website=kksanskrituni.digitaluniversity.ac|access-date=2018-08-30}}</ref>
There are also some smaller schools at Goa, Beed and Ujjain.
These are working as independent autonomous bodies. Different institutes offer education in different languages as suitable for the students and audiences around e.g. Institutes in Maharashtra prefer Marathi medium while those in Karnataka go for Kannada, Hindi is medium in U P and M.P,and Punjabi in Punjab and so on. Some have started training in various mediums including Hindi and English too along with the local language.
Naradiya Keertan knows no boundaries.It accepts saying from great authors all over the world,if they suit their subject under consideration as to prove the principle or spiritual lessons.The training is also available by postal course also if one wants to do it at home as self studying,with outside guidance in literature and music.A good knowledge of "Sanskrit" the ancient language of India is essential for a best performer.Mostly it tells stories of old mythology and religious deeds of great lives including god and godly men.
== Rashtriya Keertan == having taken inspiration from Indian freedom fighter Lokmanya Tilak, a medical practitioner from a small town of Wai- district Satara shri Dattopant Patwardhan, left his profession and became the pioneer of this form of Naradiya Keertan . He started this new era of Rashtriya keertan. he used the format of Naradiya keertan to teach masses and make awareness amongst them about the struggle for freedom against the British regime.He used many mythological stories from great epics which gave the message to masses and encouraged the movement for liberty. In modern times, stories of great scientists, warriors, freedom fighters and social reformers National leaders,battles fought, etc.are conveniently selected to entertain and educate the masses.So, Naradiya keertan is still a popular tool of mass education .It serves today as an art of spiritual training through entertainment.It is devotion with added stint of an art.
== Ramdasi Keertan ==
This form was named after [[Samarth Ramdas]]. Here the format is like Naradiya Keertan, only difference is it is based on poetry by Samarth Ramdas, and mostly the stories selected are from "Ramayana". In between chanting is also dedicated to lord Ram, glorifying his deeds and bravery. In his world known book "[[Dasbodh]]", Samarth Ramdas has explained in detail how a keertan should be performed effectively.
== Varkari Keertan == Varkari Keertan was pioneered by [[Namdev|Sant Namdev]] around 900 years back in Maharashtra. It is usually based on poetry of 7 famous saints of Maharashtra namely, Saint Nivruttinath, [[Dnyaneshwar|Sant Dnyaneshwar]], Sopandev, Muktabai, saint Eknath, Saint Namdev, and [[Saint Tukaram]] maharaj. Sometimes other sayings of saints are chosen.
The show goes for 2 or 3 hours as time permits and is not divided into parts like "Naradiya Keertan". This form was effectively performed for years by personalities like "Hari Bhakti Parayan" (sincere devotee of god) Sonopant (mama) Dandekar, Dhunda maharaj Deglurkar, Babamaharaj Satarkar, Dekhanebuwa, and many others in modern times. An institute at Alandi near Pune offers training in this form of Keertan.
== Jugalbandi Keertan ==
This format is just like Naradiya Keertan. It was most evolved form that is performed by two persons together. The philosophy is presented from all angles, sometimes contradicting each other. The performance is more interesting as it goes in question-Answer form, sometimes creating a dialogue with audiences also. Finally both the performers come to a conclusion that gives some spiritual lesson for the listeners.

{{Good article}} {{Infobox song | name = Monster | cover = Monster-Kanye-West-.png | alt = | type = single | artist = [[Kanye West]] featuring [[Jay-Z]], [[Rick Ross]], [[Bon Iver]] and [[Nicki Minaj]] | album = [[My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy]] | released = {{Start date|2010|10|23}} | format = | recorded = 2010 | studio = | venue = | genre = {{hlist|[[Hip hop music|Hip hop]]|[[horrorcore]]}} | length = 6:18 | label = {{hlist|[[Roc-A-Fella Records|Roc-A-Fella]]|[[Def Jam Recordings|Def Jam]]}} | writer = {{hlist|[[Kanye West]]|[[Jay-Z]]|[[Rick Ross]]|[[Nicki Minaj]]|[[Justin Vernon]]|Daniel Lynas}} | producer = {{hlist|[[Kanye West]]|[[Mike Dean (producer)|Mike Dean]]|[[Plain Pat]]}} | chronology = [[Kanye West]] | prev_title = [[Runaway (Kanye West song)|Runaway]] | prev_year = 2010 | next_title = [[Start It Up (song)|Start It Up]] | next_year = 2010 | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Jay-Z]] | type = single | prev_title = [[Hot Tottie]] | prev_year = 2010 | title = Monster | year = 2010 | next_title = [[H•A•M]] | next_year = 2011 }} {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Rick Ross]] | type = single | prev_title = [[All I Do Is Win]] | prev_year = 2010 | title = Monster | year = 2010 | next_title = [[Swagger Right]] | next_year = 2010 }} {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Bon Iver]] | type = singles | prev_title = [[Skinny Love]] | prev_year = 2008 | title = Monster | year = 2010 | next_title = [[Fall Creek Boys Choir]] | next_year = 2011 }} {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Nicki Minaj]] | type = singles | prev_title = [[Right Thru Me]] | prev_year = 2010 | title = Monster | year = 2010 | next_title = [[I Ain't Thru]] | next_year = 2010 }} }} "'''Monster'''" is a song by American [[hip hop music|hip hop]] recording artist [[Kanye West]], released as the third single from his fifth studio album, ''[[My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy]]'' (2010). The track features rappers {{nowrap|[[Jay-Z]]}}, [[Rick Ross]], [[Nicki Minaj]], and singer [[Justin Vernon]] of [[indie folk]] group [[Bon Iver]]. All five credited performers have writing credits on the [[posse cut]], with the production handled by West and [[Mike Dean (producer)|Mike Dean]]. Lyrically, the song expresses often disturbing, [[horror film]] influenced concepts, with some comparing the track's eerie aesthetic to the [[Michael Jackson]] song "[[Thriller (song)|Thriller]]". The song contains an atmospheric, drum-heavy composition, notable for featuring no [[Sampling (music)|sample]]s. Originally released through West's [[GOOD Friday]] initiative, a weekly free music giveaway started by the rapper to promote ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'', the song was later confirmed to be featured on the album, and was released as a [[Music download|digital download]] on October 23. The song was listed amongst the best tracks of 2010 by publications, with ''[[NME]]'' placing it at number 53 on its list of the "150 Best Tracks of the Past 15 Years". The song debuted and peaked on the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] at position 18. The track was promoted with a [[music video]] directed by [[Jake Nava]]. The music video had several references to horror films and featured extensive horror imagery, with [[zombies]], decapitated corpses and heavily atmospheric cinematography. The music video was widely controversial, being banned from [[MTV]]. The video has been criticized for its portrayal of women, and the content of the video was described as weird and disturbing in nature. ==Background== To promote his upcoming fifth album, West launched GOOD Fridays, a weekly free music giveaway. The intention was to release a free new song every Friday for a few months, and the weekly tracks generally featured various rappers from his label, [[GOOD Music]], and other artists he usually collaborated with.{{cite web|last=Kaufman |first=Gil |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1646259/20100823/west_kanye.jhtml |title=Kanye West Promises New Song Every Week Through Christmas – Music, Celebrity, Artist News |publisher=MTV. Viacom|date=2010-08-23 |accessdate=2011-02-26}} In the first week West released onto his website a remix of the album's first single, "[[Power (Kanye West song)|Power]]", and "Monster" was released on the second week.{{cite web|last=Montgomery|first=James|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1650356/20101019/west_kanye.jhtml|title=Kanye West Reveals Which Good Friday Tracks Are On Fantasy|publisher=[[MTV News]]. [[Viacom]]|date=2010-10-19|accessdate=2011-08-11}} The song was promptly removed from his website and replaced with another track, with "Monster" being uploaded as a digital single onto [[iTunes]]. West announced that "Monster" was actually intended for his collaborative album ''[[Watch the Throne]]'' with Jay-Z.{{cite web|last=Nadeska|first=Alexis|url=http://www.theboombox.com/2010/08/30/kanye-west-jay-z-watch-the-throne-monster/|title=Kanye West and Jay-Z Team Up for Joint EP, Release 'Monster'|publisher=BoomBox|date=2010-08-30|accessdate=2011-08-11}} West's announcement failed to surface however, and the song actually appeared on ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'' and was released as the album's third single. ===Recording=== Following some media controversies, West chose to record his fifth studio ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'' in a reclusive manner in [[Oahu]], [[Hawaii]].Rodriguez, Jayson (2010-05-25). [http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1640340/kanye-wests-power-producer-explains-how-song-happened.jhtml Kanye West's 'Power' Producer Explains How Song Happened]. [[MTV]]. [[Viacom]] Retrieved on 2010-11-30. Like the majority of the album, "Monster" was composed there.Columnist (2010-09-03). [https://web.archive.org/web/20160304031620/http://www.posh24.com/kanye_west/kanye_west_hiding_out_in_milan Kanye West Hiding Out in Milan!]. Posh24. Retrieved on 2010-11-30. Rapper Rick Ross was invited to Hawaii to work with West, because West was set to produce the song "Live Fast, Die Young", which appeared on ''[[Teflon Don (album)|Teflon Don]]'', an album by Ross. While Ross was there with West in his recording studio, he actually walked in on West while recording another song. Ross was not initially intended to be featured on West's album, however Ross was so impressed with what he heard he decided to record a quick, though short verse.{{cite web|last=Reid |first=Shaheem |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1648837/rick-ross-monster-proves-nicki-minaj-one-greatest.jhtml |title=Rick Ross Says 'Monster' Proves Nicki Minaj Is 'One Of The Greatest'|publisher=MTV. Viacom|date=2010-08-27 |accessdate=2010-09-28}} Ross had the concept of the song explained to him by West, which according to Ross, blew him away in presentation. West was so impressed by Ross that he invited him back to his studio during the final stages of the album, where he also appeared on "[[Devil in a New Dress]]".{{cite web|last=Rodriguez|first=Jayson|title=Rick Ross Recalls 'Pressure' Of Kanye West's 'Devil In A New Dress'|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1652169/rick-ross-recalls-pressure-kanye-wests-devil-new-dress.jhtml|date=2010-11-10|work=MTV|publisher=Viacom|accessdate=2011-07-27}} While Ross was there, both Jay-Z and Minaj were recording their verses. Ross expressed his admiration for Minaj, who impressed him during the recording. He stated that what he had observed had earned him respect for Minaj, who called the recording process a "moment of history". {{Double image|upright|Rick Ross in 2011.jpg|190|Nicki Minaj cropped.jpg|180|Rap artists [[Rick Ross]] (''left'') and [[Nicki Minaj]] (''right'') are both featured on the song. Ross was impressed with the song's concept and asked if he could deliver the intro. Minaj appeared on the song due in part to her admiration of Jay-Z. Ross expressed admiration for Minaj, and praised her lyricism. }} Minaj expressed excitement when approached to collaborate on the song, and she had contributed 32 [[Bar (music)|bars]] to the track. Her main inspiration behind working on the track was the possibility of meeting Jay-Z, with whom she was obsessed since a young age.{{cite web|last=Ziegbe|first=Mawuse|title=Nicki Minaj Remembers Being 'Obsessed' With Jay-Z|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1651069/nicki-minaj-remembers-being-obsessed-with-jay-z.jhtml|date=2010-10-28|work=MTV|publisher=Viacom|accessdate=2011-07-27}} According to her, she literally couldn't have a conversation without quoting a line by him, and it was a dream come true to collaborate with the artist. Minaj had recorded her lines around four months before the lyrics finally appeared on the song. Minaj described both Jay-Z and West as "icons", and stated that she was blessed to be working with them. In an interview with [[Rap-Up]], Minaj mused "never in a billion years would've thought that I would've not only been on a song with one of them but both them".{{cite web|last=Ryan|first=Sean|title= Nicki Minaj Addresses Marriage Rumors, Talks "Monster"| url= http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/news/id.12166/title.nicki-minaj-addresses-marriage-rumors-talks-monster|date=2010-08-08|work=HipHopDX|accessdate=2011-07-27}} Justin Vernon's involvement on the song stemmed from being approached by West directly. West first got into contact with Vernon when he directly phoned him, with the intention of sampling his song "Woods". The two talked on the phone for about 40 minutes, where West explained some of the concepts for the project, and invited him down to his studio in Hawaii. West is a big admirer of Bon Iver's album ''[[For Emma, Forever Ago]]'', and was impressed with Vernon's unique use of [[auto-tune]]. The two artists became friends while playing games of [[basketball]] together, and West introduced him to [[Jeff Bhasker]], one of his main producers. Vernon was sampled on another song from the album, "[[Lost in the World]]" and appears on vocals on "Monster". While there during recording sessions, he had reportedly recorded 10 tracks. He watched Minaj record her verse, and he too, expressed admiration for Minaj's performance on the song, however he noted that initially he had no idea who she was. Vernon described the process as highly artistic, stating that the fourteen-hour day recording schedule allowed for a lot of fun and creativity.{{cite web|last=Hill|first=Logan|title=Bon Iver's Justin Vernon on Recording Kanye's Dark Fantasy|url=http://www.vulture.com/2010/11/bon_ivers_justin_vernon_on.html|date=2010-10-14|work=Vulture. [[New York (magazine)|New York Magazine]]|accessdate=2011-07-27}} West, talking about recording the song with Vernon, stated that he was "similar to me, where he just does shit just so people would be like, 'Oh shit, how did you do that? How did that happen?' He's just a really cool guy to be around."{{cite web|author=Kreps, Daniel |title=Kanye West Debuts 'Monster,' With Jay-Z and Bon Iver|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/kanye-west-debuts-monster-with-jay-z-and-bon-iver-20100830 |work=[[Rolling Stone]]|publisher=Jann S. Wenner |date=2010-08-30 |accessdate=2010-12-18}} ==Composition== {{Listen |filename = Monsterkanye.ogg |pos = right |title = "Monster" |description = A 30-second sample of "Monster" which features the closing lines of Kanye's verse and the beginning of the chorus. The production has been described as unnerving, with several tonal shifts in frequency. }} Considered a [[horrorcore]] song,{{cite web |url=http://www.westword.com/music/horrorcore-from-esham-to-hopsin-a-look-at-the-history-of-raps-most-terrifying-subgenre-5717030 |title=Horrorcore: From Esham to Hopsin, a look at the history of rap's most terrifying subgenre |work=[[Westword]] |last=Hubbell |first=Noah |date=August 12, 2013 |accessdate=April 21, 2017}} "Monster" has been described as brooding, disturbing, creepy and the "weirdest A-list event-rap posse cut in recent memory."Conner, Thomas (2010-12-11). [https://web.archive.org/web/20160201212233/http://blogs.suntimes.com/music/2010/11/cd_review_kanye_west_my_beauti.html Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-21. The song begins with an ominous, distorted vocal roar, sung by Justin Vernon of Bon Iver, with Vernon declaring "I shoot the lights out", which sets up the dark atmosphere of the track.Weiner, Jonah (2010-11-22). [http://www.slate.com/id/2275730/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[Slate (magazine)|Slate]]''. Retrieved on 2011-01-29. The intro of the song is followed by a brief verse given by Ross, delivered in the rapping style of [[boom bap]]. In a deep voice, Ross asserts the lines "bitch, I'm a monster, no good bloodsucker, fat motherfucker, now look who's in trouble," over the eerie production featured during the beginning.{{cite web|author=Breihan, Tom |url=http://pitchfork.com/reviews/tracks/11970-monster-ft-justin-vernon-rick-ross-jay-z-and-nicki-minaj/ |title=Pitchfork: The Playlist: Kanye West – "Monster" |publisher=[[Pitchfork (website)|''Pitchfork'']] |date=2010-09-07 |accessdate=2010-12-18}}{{cite web|last=Ziegbe |first=Mawuse |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1646722/kanye-west-drops-monster-single-with-jay-z-nicki-minaj.jhtml |title=Kanye West Drops 'Monster' Single With Jay-Z, Nicki Minaj|publisher=MTV. Viacom|date=2010-08-27 |accessdate=2011-02-26}} Following the introduction by Ross, West then provides the song's [[Hook (music)|hook]], singing "everybody know / I'm a motherfuckin' monster" in a heavily distorted manner. West then launches into a full verse. ''[[Chicago Sun-Times]]'' writer Thomas Conner stated that West rhyming "esophagus" with "sarcophagus" was surely a hip-hop first. Jay-Z appears on the song after West's verse, and raps in a more forceful, sinister flow. During his verse, Jay-Z references several different horror characters, including the [[Bigfoot|Sasquatch]], [[Godzilla]], [[King Kong]], the [[Loch Ness Monster]], [[goblin]]s, [[ghoul]]s and [[zombie]]s. Lyrically Jay-Z discusses his discontent at former associates, and concludes his verse by admitting that his [[achilles' heel]] is "love". Minaj is the final rapper to appear on the song, who delivers her lines in an urgent, energetic manner. Minaj's delivery has been described as surreal, changing delivery in mid-line. The song ends in a spooky, hoarse vocal riff delivered by Vernon, reminiscent of the track "Thriller". An extended vocal riff, described as "scratchy" closes the track.Paine, Jake (2010-10-04). [http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/album-reviews/id.1569/title.kanye-west--my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy Kanye West My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy]. HipHopDX. Retrieved on 2010-11-27. [[Pitchfork (website)|''Pitchfork'']]'s Tom Breihan summarized the content of the song, writing:
Rick Ross drops by to say hi, keeping his appearance so brief that I can't help but wonder what he's even doing here. Justin Vernon inexplicably bookends the thing, pushing his [[falsetto]] into Antony range on the outro and muttering befuddling lyrics that have nothing to do with the rest of the song. All this over the straight-up funkiest beat Kanye West has made in years, a rippling [[Electro (music)|electro]] push-pull that adds an effortless strut to his recent progged-out chilliness. But all that other stuff fades into the background when Nicki Minaj shows up. [...] She's a whirlwind of energy, showing her full repertoire of nutso voices and kicking the living fuck out of the beat, sounding like she's having an absolute blast the whole time."
The song heavily features bombastic tribal drums, and paranoia-inducing strings that create a feeling of tension.Sheffield, Rob (November 22, 2010). [https://www.rollingstone.com/music/albumreviews/my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy-20101109 Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[Rolling Stone]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-11. The beat of "Monster" has been described as a "hyperventilating death rattle" by ''[[The Washington Post]]''{{'}}s Chris Richards, commenting that the song was permeated with dark, urgent-sounding moans.Richards, Chris (2010-11-19). [https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2010/11/19/AR2010111903704.html Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[The Washington Post]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-19. The chorus of the song has two separate meanings; on the surface, it appears that West is bragging about his abilities as a rapper, while also making a comment on the media's reception of him, with lines like "gossip, gossip, nigga just stop it, everybody knows I'm a muthafuckin' monster".{{cite web|author=Beringer, Drew|url=http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=2027712|title=Kanye West – My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy|work=[[AbsolutePunk]]|publisher=Buzz Media |date=2010-11-22|accessdate=2012-03-17}} ==Critical reception== {{Double image|left|Jay-zlivein2010.jpg|95|Kanye West Shankbone 2009 Vanity Fair.jpg|80|''[[Watch the Throne]]'' collaborators [[Jay-Z]] (left) and [[Kanye West]] (right) received acclaim for their performances on "Monster". Critics were divided on who had the superior verse out of the two, though Minaj was often cited as surpassing both rappers on the track. The production by West was also widely praised. }} Becky Bain of [[Idolator (website)|Idolator]] stated that while the song featured five distinct artists, Minaj actually had the brightest appearance on the song.{{cite web|url=http://idolator.com/5609121/kanye-west-jay-z-nicki-minaj-monster |title=Kanye West And Jay-Z's "Monster" Track Features Nicki Minaj, Rick Ross & Bon Iver |publisher =[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]. Buzz Media |date= 2010-09-01|accessdate=2011-02-09}} Sara D. Anderson of [[AOL]] gave the song a positive review, complimenting each artist on their contribution.{{cite web|author= Anderson. Sara D |url=http://www.aolradioblog.com/2010/09/01/kanye-west-monster-jay-z-nicki-minaj-rick-ross/ |title=Kanye West, 'Monster' Feat. Jay-Z, Nicki Minaj, Rick Ross – New Song |publisher=[[AOL Radio]] |date=2010-08-20 |accessdate=2011-02-09 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140427194230/http://www.aolradioblog.com/2010/09/01/kanye-west-monster-jay-z-nicki-minaj-rick-ross/ |archivedate=2014-04-27 |deadurl=yes}} Chris Ryan of ''[[MTV]]'' positively reviewed West, Jay-Z and Minaj as the stand out rappers in the song, stating "on car stereos, computers and in clubs all over, nothing got more burn than 'Monster,' his new beastly posse cut. Kanye spits about his presence being a present to us all, Jay-Z comes through with what might be his strongest verse in years, and that's where Nicki comes in, more than holding her own against the bad boys."{{cite web|url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2010/08/30/kanye-west-monster-jayz-nicki-minaj/ |title=Song You Need To Know: Kanye West, Featuring Jay-Z, Rick Ross, Nicki Minaj And Bon Iver, 'Monster' |publisher=MTV. Viacom |date=2010-08-30 |accessdate=2011-02-09}} Pitchfork Media's Ryan Dombal reported that Minaj gave the verse of her life, and applauded the contributions by Ross, who added a "hallucinatory tone" to the song.Dombal, Ryan (2010-12-21). [http://pitchfork.com/reviews/albums/14880-my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. [[Pitchfork (website)|''Pitchfork'']]. Retrieved on 2010-11-21. Another Pitchfork writer, Tom Breihan mused that the track contained the "straight-up funkiest beat" West has made in years, while commenting that Minaj was the best in show. ''[[The Village Voice]]''{{'}}s Sean Fennessey commented that "Monster" was the track that announced Minaj's "brilliance" to most people, stating that when the posse cut "crept up the Hot 100, the song became more than track six—it became an essential part of this album's story, delivered months early."Fennessey, Sean (2010-11-17). [http://www.villagevoice.com/2010-11-17/music/kanye-west-finally-unraveled/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[The Village Voice]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-17. Alex Denney of ''[[NME]]'' mused that the track "proves a riotous bit of respite" and features West "sending up his rep with a self-mocking diatribe about drowning his pain in a blizzard of blow jobs and mass adulation while Nicki Minaj sets the dials to 'ridiculous' with a fire-breathing, raga-inflected verse."Denney, Alex (2010-12-19). [http://www.nme.com/reviews/kanye-west/11723 Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[NME]]''. [[IPC Media]] Retrieved on 2010-11-22. Embling of [[Tiny Mix Tapes]] felt that with "super-sized cipher cuts" like "Monster" and "[[So Appalled]]", West balanced out some of the darker moments of ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'', and that the song contained heavy "shit-talking."Embling (November 2010). [http://www.tinymixtapes.com/music-review/Kanye-West-My-Beautiful-Dark-Twisted-Fantasy Kanye West - My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy | Music Review | Tiny Mix Tapes]. [[Tiny Mix Tapes]]. Retrieved on 2011-04-30. [[Slant Magazine]]'s Cole Matthew also commented that posse cuts "Monster" and "So Appalled" were amongst the hardest tracks ever produced by West.Cole, Matthew (November 20, 2010). [http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/kanye-west-my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy/2325 Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. [[Slant Magazine]]. Retrieved on 2010-11-20. [[IGN]]'s Chad Grischow mused that the track featured great guest appearances from Jay-Z and Minaj, going as far as saying that Minaj's performance "clears up what all the hype is about for anyone still unsure".Grischow, Chad (2010-12-23). [http://music.ign.com/articles/113/1136440p1.html Kanye West: My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy Review - Music Review at IGN]. [[IGN]]. Retrieved on 2011-04-30. Robert Christgau of [[MSN Music]] stated that West perfectly acknowledged his status as a rapper, and noted that his persona seems to be aware that his "bling-and-sex brag is about to get blown away by padrone Jay-Z's 'all I see is these niggaz I made millionaires/Millin about' and pink-haired Nicki Minaj's 'bitch from Sri Lanka-Willy Wonka-watch the queen conquer' trifecta."Christgau, Robert (2010-11-30). [https://www.webcitation.org/5udhsVokJ?url=http://social.entertainment.msn.com/music/blogs/expert-witness-blogpost.aspx?post=b533be49-60d0-4718-b4b3-2bf1928c2e40 Consumer Guide: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. [[MSN Music]]. Archived from [http://social.entertainment.msn.com/music/blogs/expert-witness-blogpost.aspx?post=b533be49-60d0-4718-b4b3-2bf1928c2e40 the original] on 2010-11-30. David Amidon of [[PopMatters]] praised the production of the song, and stated that the track features "glass-shattering bass".Amidon, David (2010-12-20). [http://www.popmatters.com/pm/review/133594-kanye-west-my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. [[PopMatters]]. Retrieved on 2010-11-22. Nitsuh Abebe of ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]'' declared that Minaj gave one of the best verses of the year.Abebe, Nitsuh (November 12, 2010). [http://nymag.com/daily/entertainment/2010/11/filthy_rich_kanye_wests_royal.html Filthy, Rich: Kanye West’s Royal ''Fantasy'']. ''[[New York (magazine)|New York]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-12. Nathan Rabin of ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' praised the guest picks on the album, musing that West trades verses with the "few superstars fit to breathe his rarified air, including Jay-Z, Rick Ross, and Nicki Minaj, who single-handedly justifies her deafening buzz with her verse on the song."Rabin, Nathan (2010-11-23). [http://www.avclub.com/articles/kanye-west-my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy,48117/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[The A.V. Club]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-23. [[Kitty Empire]] of ''[[The Guardian]]'' praised West's performance on the song describing it as "brilliant", but also noted that on the particular song Minaj and Jay-Z were superior to him, citing Minaj's verse as her career's best.Empire, Kitty (2010-11-19). [https://www.theguardian.com/music/2010/nov/19/kanye-west-review Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[The Guardian]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-19. Dan Vidal of ''[[URB (magazine)|URB]]'' stated that West milks the potential of his guest rappers to the most impressive degree, reporting that Jay-Z's generally relaxed performance was "with a fiery growl on" and that it "features Nicki Minaj going even more bonkers with her flow than we're accustomed to."Vidal, Dan (2010-11-23). [http://www.urb.com/2010/11/23/kanye-west-my-beautiful-dark-twisted-fantasy/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. ''[[URB (magazine)|URB]]''. Retrieved on 2010-12-08. [[Sputnikmusic]]'s Channing Freeman echoed the consensus about Minaj stating that her verse was the most memorable part of the song, though felt that Bon Iver's appearance didn't add up to much.Freeman, Channing (2010-11-11). [https://www.sputnikmusic.com/review/40192/Kanye-West-My-Beautiful-Dark-Twisted-Fantasy/ Review: ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'']. [[Sputnikmusic]]. Retrieved on 2010-11-12. ===Accolades=== The song was named the "Collaboration of the Year" 2010 by HipHopDX.{{cite web|url=http://www.hiphopdx.com/index/editorials/id.1633/title.the-2010-hiphopdx-year-end-awards |title=The 2010 HipHopDX Year End Awards |publisher=HipHopDX |date=2010-12-13 |accessdate=2011-02-09}} Minaj's verse for the song was named "Verse of the Year" by the same website. ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' ranked it number 10 on its list of the Best Singles of 2010.Staff (2010-12-07). [https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/68404/239428?RS_show_page=4 Rolling Stone's Best Singles of 2010]. ''[[Rolling Stone]]''. Retrieved on 2010-12-07. Rap-Up declared the song the third best of 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/12/29/rap-ups-10-best-songs-of-2010/ |title=Rap-Up's 10 Best Songs of 2010 |publisher=[[Rap-Up]]. Devin Lazerine |date=2010-12-21 |accessdate=2010-12-28}} [[MTV News]] declared the track the 14th best of the year, with other West singles "Power" and "[[Runaway (Kanye West song)|Runaway]]" making the top 10.{{cite web|url=http://newsroom.mtv.com/2010/12/10/mtv-top-25-songs-of-2010-usher-eminem-kanye/ |title=The MTV News Top 25 Songs Of 2010: Usher, Eminem, Lady Gaga And Others Make The Grade|date=2010-12-10 |publisher=[[MTV News]].Viacom |accessdate=2011-12-28}} In October 2011, ''NME'' placed it at number 53 on its list "150 Best Tracks of the Past 15 Years", with the site's staff stating that while West had a good performance on the song, it was "star turns from Jay-Z (channeling his world-weary hip hop legend who just needed a cuddle) and Nicki Minaj (a show stealing turn from the heir apparent who was battling herself as much as the haters) that took this track over."{{cite web|author=Staff|url=http://www.nme.com/list/150-best-tracks-of-the-past-15-years/248648/page/10|title=60-51 |publisher=IPC Media|work=NME |date=2012-06-18 |accessdate=2011-05-21}} In 2013, Complex Magazine gave Minaj's Monster verse the title "Best Rap Verse of the Past 5 Years".http://www.complex.com/music/2013/05/best-rap-verses-of-the-last-5-years/ In January 2011, ''[[The Village Voice]]''{{'}}s [[Pazz & Jop]] annual critics' poll named "Monster" the sixth-best single of 2010; West's other singles "[[Power (Kanye West song)|Power]]" and "[[Runaway (Kanye West song)|Runaway]]" were ranked at numbers five and four, respectively on the same poll, with their parent album ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy'' ranked the best album of 2010 as well. It was ranked at number 69 by ''Rolling Stone'' on their list of "100 Greatest Hip-Hop songs of all time".{{cite web|title=Rolling Stone's 100 Greatest Hip-Hop Songs of all time|url=http://feature.rollingstone.com/100-greatest-hip-hop-songs/kanye-west-feat-jay-z-rick-ross-bon-iver-nicki-minaj/|website=Rollingstone.com|accessdate=April 19, 2016}} ==Chart performance== "Monster" was sent to radio on September 21, and it was released to the iTunes Store on October 23, 2010 around [[Halloween]].[https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/monster-single/id399733768 Monster - Single]. [[iTunes Store]]. Retrieved on 2010-11-28. It spent five weeks on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, peaking at number 18 on the chart.[{{BillboardURLbyName|artist=kanye west|chart=all}} Kanye West Album & Song Chart History – Hot 100]. ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''. [[Prometheus Global Media]] Retrieved on 2010-11-30. The song also appeared within the top 30 on both the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Rap Songs]] and [[Hot R&B/Hip-Hop Songs]] charts. The song also appeared on the [[UK Singles Chart]] at position 146. "Monster" was certified platinum on March 31, 2014.https://www.riaa.com/goldandplatinumdata.php?content_selector=gold-platinum-searchable-database ==Live performances== [[File:Kanye West At the Big Chill 2011.jpg|thumb|180px|right|The mostly red outfit worn by West during many of his performances while promoting ''My Beautiful Dark Twisted Fantasy''.]] The song was performed at Jay-Z's and [[Eminem]]'s "[[The Home & Home Tour|Home & Home]]" concert in the new [[New York Yankees|Yankee]] [[Yankee Stadium|Stadium]], during Jay-Z's portion of the performance. Both Minaj and West joined Jay-Z at the concert and performed the song together as a group, though Ross was absent.{{cite web|last=Reid |first=Shaheem |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1647790/20100914/jay_z.jhtml |title=Jay-Z, Eminem Joined By Kanye West, Beyonce, Others At Yankee Stadium – Music, Celebrity, Artist News |publisher=MTV. Viacom |date=2010-09-14 |accessdate=2011-02-09}} After joining Jay-Z during the performance, West remained on stage and performed his own singles, including the remixed version of "Power", "[[Can't Tell Me Nothing]]" and "[[Good Life (Kanye West song)|Good Life]]". West wore exactly the same outfit he did for his 2010 [[MTV Video Music Awards]] performance and his subsequent ''[[Saturday Night Live]]'' performance; a red suit accessorized with his gold [[Egpytians|Egyptian]] god [[Horus]] necklace and red [[Louis Vuitton]] shoes.{{cite web|url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2010/09/14/jay-z-kanye-west-nicki-minaj-yankee-stadium/ |title=Star Spotting: Jay-Z, Kanye West And Nicki Minaj Have A Monster Night At Yankee Stadium |publisher=MTV. Viacom |date=2010-09-14 |accessdate=2011-02-09}} During a live performance in [[New York City]], West joined Ross and performed "Devil in a New Dress" and "Monster".{{Cite web|url=http://hothiphopdetroit.com/national/news-gossip/biggreg/kanye-west-rick-ross-devil-in-a-new-dress-live-in-nyc/|title=Kanye West and Rick Ross, Devil in a New Dress Live in NYC|date=2010-10-24|first=Big|last=Greg|work=Hiphopdetroit|accessdate=2010-10-23}} Minaj performed the song live at [[Britney Spears]]' [[Femme Fatale Tour]] as one of the final songs in her setlist. On one occasion, West performed the track alongside Minaj on the tour, on August 2, 2011 at the [[Nassau Coliseum]] in [[Long Island]], [[New York (state)|New York]], as a surprise guest.{{Cite web|first=Becky|last=Bain|url=http://idolator.com/5961492/nicki-minaj-brings-out-kanye-west-for-monster-during-femme-fatale-tour|title=Nicki Minaj Brings Out Kanye West For "Monster" During Femme Fatale Tour|date=2010-08-03|publisher =Idolator. Buzz Media|accessdate=2011-08-07}} During his set at the [[Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival]], West performed "Monster" during the first half of his setlist.{{Cite web|first=|last=Staff|url=http://idolator.com/5852951/listen-to-kanye-wests-full-set-from-coachella|title=Listen To Kanye West's Full Set From Coachella|date=2011-05-11|publisher =Idolator. Buzz Media|accessdate=2011-08-07}} The performance was accompanied by Vernon who provided his vocal hook on the song. West's performance was described as "one of the most memorable performances in Coachella history."{{cite web|last=DiMeglio|first=Mary |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1662043/coachella-festival-kanye-west.jhtml |title=Kanye West Slays Coachella Festival's Last Night|publisher=MTV. Viacom |date=2011-05-10 |accessdate=2011-02-26}} The song was performed by West and Jay-Z during their Watch the Throne Tour.{{cite web|last=Markman|first=Rob|title=Jay-Z, Kanye West's Throne Tour Has Thrilling Liftoff|publisher=MTV News. Viacom|date= 2011-10-29|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1673399/kanye-west-jay-z-watch-the-throne-tour.jhtml|accessdate=2011-10-29}} Minaj has also performed her verse on the European and American legs of her debut concert tour, the [[Pink Friday Tour]]. She has also rapped her verse on her [[Pink Friday: Reloaded Tour]]. ==Music video== ===Background and synopsis=== An unfinished version of a [[music video]], directed by [[Jake Nava]] leaked online before the official release on December 30, 2010.{{cite web|url=http://www.rap-up.com/2010/12/30/video-kanye-west-f-rick-ross-jay-z-nicki-minaj-monster/ |title=Video: Kanye West f/ Rick Ross, Jay-Z, & Nicki Minaj – 'Monster' |publisher=Rap-Up. Devin Lazerine |date=2010-12-30 |accessdate=2011-02-09}} West was annoyed at the leak of the video, and nearly shelved the video altogether.{{cite web|author=Angelo |url = http://www.bloodygoodhorror.com/bgh/blogs/01/31/2012/10-horror-heavy-music-videos-not-named-thriller |title=10 Horror Heavy Music Videos NOT Named Thriller | work = BloodyGoodHorror | publisher = [[Spike.com]] |date= 2012-01-31 |accessdate= 10 July 2012}} A finalized version of the video was officially released on June 4, 2011 on West's official website. A promotional trailer for the music video was released online.{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/music/2010/12/08/2010-12-08_kanye_west_monster_music_video_teaser_shows_models_scantily_clad_and_apparently_.html |title=Kanye West 'Monster' music video teaser shows models, scantily clad and apparently dead |work=''[[Daily News (New York)|Daily News]]''|publisher=[[Mortimer Zuckerman]] |date=2010-12-08 |accessdate=2011-02-09}} When released, the video came with a disclaimer, stating "the following content is in no way to be interpreted as misogynistic or negative towards any groups of people. It is an art piece and it shall be taken as such."{{cite web|author=Perpetua, Matthew |title=Kanye West Finally releases 'Monster' video|url= https://www.rollingstone.com/music/videos/kanye-west-finally-releases-monster-video-20110606|work=Rolling Stone|publisher=Jann S. Wenner |date=2010-06-06 |accessdate=2010-12-18}} The music video is inspired by horror films and extensively features [[Gothic art|gothic]] and horror related imagery, including references to ''[[Michael Jackson's Thriller (music video)|Michael Jackson's Thriller]]''. The video features references to horror [[cult films]] such as ''[[American Psycho (film)|American Psycho]]'' and ''[[Saw (2004 film)|Saw]]'' as well as the supposedly haunted painting ''[[The Hands Resist Him]]''. ''The Hand Resists Him'' is a painting created by artist [[Bill Stoneham]] in 1972, depicting a young boy and female doll standing in front of a glass paneled door against which many hands are pressed.{{cite web|last=Mcall|first=Tris|title=Monster hits: More pop stars are channeling horror iconography|publisher=[[New Jersey On-Line]]|date= 2011-08-30|url=http://www.nj.com/entertainment/music/index.ssf/2011/10/monster_hits_more_pop_stars_ar.html|accessdate=2011-10-29}} The painting became famous for apparently being haunted.Kershner, Jim (2002-10-31) [http://www.spokesmanreview.com/news-story.asp?date=103102&ID=s1244540 Painting goes bump in the night: Spokane artist's work has become so hyped on Internet it's scary], The Spokesman Review (2007-05-13) The painting is referenced during a scene in the video where West attempts to hold a door closed, from the monsters outside attempting to enter. The video features mostly naked [[Cadaver|corpse]] looking models, some of which are decapitated. West's role in the video is similar to [[Victor Frankenstein|Doctor Frankenstein]], with the video set in a [[castle]]. Jay-Z appears in the video dressed in a [[tuxedo]], standing in front of a nude corpse in a darkly-lit library. The video contains two versions of Minaj; a [[vampire]] version who is dressed in a [[Gothic fashion|gothic]] inspired outfit (representing her alter ego Roman Zolanski), and a pink-haired version (representing her alter ego Barbie) which the other half tortures during the video.{{cite web|url=http://www.promonews.tv/2011/06/27/kanye-west-%E2%80%98monster%E2%80%99-by-jake-nava/ |title=Kanye West 'Monster' by Jake Nava |work= PromoNews |date=2011-06-27 |accessdate=2012-02-09}} Zombies also appear in the video, with hanging corpses and blood-splattered furniture. ===Reception=== [[HitFix]]'s Melinda Newman called the video both "chilling" and "raw" and stated that the video captured the concept of the song well, expressing that it was a "brutal reveal of West's psyche".{{cite web|last=Newman |first=Melinda |url=http://www.hitfix.com/blogs/the-beat-goes-on/posts/watch-kayne-wests-nsfw-monster-with-nicki-minaj-jay-z-and-rick-ross |title=Watch: Kayne West's NSFW 'Monster' music video with Nicki Minaj, Jay-Z, Rick Ross |publisher=[[HitFix]] |date= 2010-12-30|accessdate=2010-12-18}} Simon Vozick-Levinson of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' stated that the video should have been more creative and called it offensive, stating that Minaj's appearance was the best part.Vozick-Levinson, Simon (2010-12-30). [http://music-mix.ew.com/2010/12/30/kanye-west-monster-video/ Kanye West's gory 'Monster' video leaks, full of half-naked corpses: Amazing or appalling?]. ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]''. Retrieved on 2010-11-19. Matthew Perpetua of ''Rolling Stone'' commented that the video was morbid, comparing it to "Thriller", though noted that "instead of dancing zombies, he gives us undead, barely dressed and occasionally dismembered models".{{cite web|author=Perpetua, Matthew |title=Kanye West Finally releases 'Monster' video|url= https://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/video-kanye-wests-monster-featuring-nicki-minaj-leaks-20101230|work=Video: Kanye West's 'Monster' Featuring Nicki Minaj Leaks|publisher=Jann S. Wenner |date=2010-12-30 |accessdate=2011-12-18}} Perpetua called Minaj's appearance "cameo of the year" describing her appearance in the video: [[File:Monsterkanyevideo.jpg|thumb|320px|A screenshot of one of the scenes in the video described as disturbing. West rearranges the bodies of two seemingly dead models in a satin bed.]]
"She switches up her delivery repeatedly over the course of 31 bars, veering between cartoonish sweetness and unhinged villainy. She dramatizes the jarring dynamic shifts in the clip by appearing as a fanged [[dominatrix]] torturing a far more innocent version of herself in a neon pink wig and frilly white dress. It's a brilliant visual take on a breathtakingly badass verse, but really, they could've just focused in on her incredible facial expressions and called it a day. She's just that entertaining to watch."
The music video for Monster was widely controversial, being banned on MTV.{{cite web|author=Bain, Becky|url=http://idolator.com/5729532/kanye-west-monster-reviews |title=Review Revue: Critics React To Kanye West's "Monster" |publisher =Idolator. Buzz Media |date= 2010-12-30|accessdate=2011-02-09}}{{cite web | url=http://www.essence.com/2011/03/06/kanye-west-monster-video-banned-on-mtv-nicki-minaj-rick-ross-jayz/| title=Kanye West 'Monster' Video Banned on MTV | accessdate=2012-02-12 | publisher= Essence}} [[Ta-Nehisi Coates]] of ''[[The Atlantic]]'' questioned "what would have become of [[John Mayer]], had he cut a video with dead black women strewn about and invoked black women throughout his lyrics in the manner Kanye does" and labeled the video both racist and sexist in nature.Coates, Ta-Nehisi. [https://www.theatlantic.com/entertainment/archive/2011/01/on-white-she-devils/68822/ "On White She-Devils"], ''[[The Atlantic]]'' 2011-01-03. However, Brandon Soderberg of ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]'' argues that the video was simply a "surreal response to hip-hop misogyny" and a "knowing provocation", and commented that the video was in fact inspired by horror films.Soderberg, Brandon. [http://www.spin.com/node/89296 "In Defense Of Kanye West's "Monster"], ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]'', June 18, 2011. Daphne Bramham of the ''[[Vancouver Sun]]'' commented that "what's entertaining about women in lingerie hanging by their necks on chains? What's artful about images of drugged, unconscious women about to be sexually assaulted?"Bramham, Daphne. [http://www2.canada.com/vancouversun/columnists/story.html?id=cae2bb1a-72e0-4031-9fc4-6adce7dd7c91&p=1 "Let's label this depravity for what it is: misogyny"]. ''[[Vancouver Sun]]'' 2011-01-15. Mikhail Lyubansky of the ''[[Huffington Post]]'' had a negative opinion of the video, stating that the video "not-so-subtly suggests that complete female passivity, lifelessness, and even death are erotic", and interpreted the message of the video as being that "for women, what's sexually desirable is passivity, lifelessness, and death."Lyubansky, Mikhail. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/mikhail-lyubansky/did-kanye-west-create-a-m_b_808507.html "Did Kanye West Create A Monster?"]. ''[[Huffington Post]]'' 2011-01-03. The release of the video was received by American activist [[Ann Simonton]] with an internet [[petition]] seeking the preemptive removal of the full video from broadcast or promotion, criticizing the video as glorifying sexual violence against women.{{cite web|url = http://truthout.org/love-hurts|title = Love Hurts|author = Simonton, Ann |publisher = Truthout|date = 2011-04-13}} Due to negative reactions the video was removed from Kanye West's [[YouTube]] channel. It is unknown if it violated YouTube's policy against showing gory content or if [[Vevo]] took it down. However, the video is available on Nicki Minaj's YouTube channel. ==Legacy== Minaj's verse has become so iconic and acclaimed that artists like [[Demi Lovato]], [[Chloë Grace Moretz]], [[Ed Sheeran]], [[Troye Sivan]], [[Millie Bobby Brown]], among others, have rapped the verse in concerts or interviews. In January 2016, singer [[Adele]] rapped Nicki Minaj's verse on ''[[The Late Late Show with James Corden]]'' during a segment called "Carpool Karaoke", which Minaj reacted to with praise.{{cite web|url=https://www.nme.com/news/music/adele-88-1194635 |title=Nicki Minaj reacts to Adele rapping her 'Monster' verse: 'She is mad ratchet' |publisher =NME |date= 2016-01-15|accessdate=2018-11-29}} British actress [[Millie Bobby Brown]] rapped the same verse while on ''[[The Tonight Show]]'' with [[Jimmy Fallon]] in September 2016.{{cite web|author=Monroe, Jazz|url=http://pitchfork.com/news/67967-watch-stranger-things-millie-bobby-brown-aka-eleven-rap-nicki-minajs-monster-verse/ |title=Watch "Stranger Things"' Millie Bobby Brown (aka Eleven) Rap Nicki Minaj's "Monster" Verse |publisher =Pitchfork |date= 2016-09-01|accessdate=2016-10-19}} Singer/Songwriter Ed Sheeran attempted to rap the verse on The Breakfast Club which was published on March 10, 2017 on the show's YouTube channel, but forgot the words to it.{{cite web|author=Roth, Madeline|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2992364/ed-sheeran-rapping-nicki-minaj-monster-verse/ |title=Ed Sheeran Rapping Nicki's 'Monster' Verse Proves He Should Stick To Singing |publisher =MTV |date= 2017-03-10|accessdate=2018-11-29}} ==Credits and personnel== *Produced by [[Kanye West]] *Additional Production by [[Mike Dean (record producer)|Mike Dean]] and [[Plain Pat]] *Recorded by [[Andrew Dawson (record producer)|Andrew Dawson]], Anthony Kilhoffer and Mike Dean at the Avex Recording Studio, [[Honolulu]] *Mixed by Mike Dean at [[Electric Lady Studios]] and Glenwood Place Studios, [[Burbank, California|Burbank]] – Assisted by Gaylord Holomalia, Christian Mochizuki and Pete Bischoff *Background Vocals: [[Justin Vernon]] *[[Piano]]: [[Jeff Bhasker]] ==Charts== {| class="wikitable sortable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center" |- ! Chart (2010–16) !! Peak
position |- ! scope="row"| Australia ([[ARIA Charts|ARIA]]){{cite web|url=https://www.auspop.com.au/2016/01/chart-watch-352/|title=CHART WATCH #352 – auspOp|publisher=auspOp|date=January 23, 2016|accessdate=January 23, 2016}} | 91 |- {{singlechart|Billboardcanadianhot100|43|artist=Kanye West|artistid={{BillboardID|Kanye West}}|rowheader=true}} |- ! scope="row"| UK Singles ([[The Official Charts Company]]){{cite web | url=http://www.zobbel.de/cluk/101204cluk.txt | title=CHART LOG UK: NEW ENTRIES UPDATE | accessdate=2011-02-16 | date=4.12.2010 | publisher=zobbel.de}} | 146 |- {{singlechart|Billboardhot100|18|artist=Kanye West|artistid={{BillboardID|Kanye West}}|rowheader=true}} |- {{singlechart|Billboardrandbhiphop|30|artist=Kanye West|artistid={{BillboardID|Kanye West}}|rowheader=true}} |- {{singlechart|Billboardrapsongs|15|artist=Kanye West|artistid={{BillboardID|Kanye West}}|rowheader=true}} |} ==Certifications== {{Certification Table Top}} {{Certification Table Entry|region=United Kingdom|artist=Kanye West|title=Monster|award=Silver|type=single|relyear=2010|accessdate=15 February 2018}} {{Certification Table Entry|region=United States|artist=Kanye West|title=Monster|award=Platinum|type=single|relyear=2010|certyear=2014|accessdate=15 February 2018}} {{Certification Table Bottom|nosales=true}} ==Release history== {| class="wikitable" |- ! Region ! Date ! Format |- |rowspan="3"|United States |rowspan="2"|September 21, 2010 |[[Rhythmic contemporary|Rhythmic radio]]{{citation needed|date=December 2013}} |- |[[Urban contemporary|Urban radio]]{{citation needed|date=December 2013}} |- | October 23, 2010 | [[Music download|Digital download]] |} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * [http://vimeo.com/24789963 Music Video] at [[Vimeo]] (due to issues with the content, the complete video cannot be uploaded onto [[YouTube]]) * {{MetroLyrics song|kanye-west|monster}} {{Kanye West songs}} {{Jay-Z songs}} {{Rick Ross}} {{Bon Iver}} {{Nicki Minaj songs}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Monster (Kanye West and Jay-Z Song)}} [[Category:2010 singles]] [[Category:Horrorcore songs]] [[Category:Kanye West songs]] [[Category:Jay-Z songs]] [[Category:Rick Ross songs]] [[Category:Nicki Minaj songs]] [[Category:Song recordings produced by Kanye West]] [[Category:Songs written by Kanye West]] [[Category:Songs written by Jay-Z]] [[Category:Songs written by Nicki Minaj]] [[Category:Music videos directed by Jake Nava]] [[Category:Music video controversies]] [[Category:Songs written by Rick Ross]] [[Category:Roc-A-Fella Records singles]] [[Category:Bon Iver songs]] [[Category:Songs written by Justin Vernon]] [[Category:Posse cuts]] [[Category:2010 songs]]
