Release date | 11 October 2002 | 2 September 2005 | 26 November 2008 | 4 September 2015 |} ===''The Transporter''=== {{Main|The Transporter}} Frank Martin ([[Jason Statham]]) is a highly skilled driver known only as "The Transporter." He will transport anything, no questions asked, always on time, and he is known as the best in the business. He strictly follows three rules when transporting: Rule Number 1: "Once the deal is made, it is final", Rule Number 2: "No names", and Rule Number 3: "Never open the package." Frank inadvertently breaks his own rule, opens the package and finds a bound and gagged woman. ===''Transporter 2''=== {{Main|Transporter 2}} Frank is working as the driver/chauffeur for a wealthy family, in the United States. Martin bonds with their young son, whom he drives to school every day. When the boy is kidnapped, Frank must again take action in order to protect his young "package" and his family. Eventually, Martin unravels a scheme involving biological weapons and the nefarious Gianni Chellini. Martin is forced to remove a bomb from the bottom of his car by executing an aerial corkscrew manoeuver underneath a crane. The crane catches the bomb and Martin escapes unharmed. Frank debuts the [[Audi A8 W12]] in this film. Inspector Tarconi plays an even more prominent role in this film. It is established that he and Frank are now friends, and Tarconi goes as far as to lie to the police to cover for Frank. His cooking prowess is established as well. ===''Transporter 3''=== {{Main|Transporter 3}} Frank has been pressured into transporting Valentina ([[Natalya Rudakova]]) the kidnapped daughter of Leonid Vasilev ([[Jeroen Krabbé]]), the head of the Environmental Protection Agency for Ukraine, from [[Marseille]] through [[Stuttgart]] and [[Budapest]] until he ends up in [[Odessa]] on the [[Black Sea]]. Along the way, with the help of Inspector Tarconi ([[François Berléand]]), Frank has to contend with the people who strong armed him to take the job, agents sent by Vasilev to intercept him, and the general non-cooperation of his passenger, who he realises is the package mid-way through the film. Despite Valentina's cynical disposition and Frank's resistance to get involved, Frank and Valentina fall for each other, while escaping from one life-threatening situation after another. Martin again drives an armoured [[Audi A8 W12]] in the film, as well as a [[BMX]] bicycle. ===''The Transporter Refueled''=== {{main|The Transporter Refueled}} In May 2013, at the [[2013 Cannes Film Festival]], a new reboot trilogy was announced with [[EuropaCorp]] and [[China]]'s [[Fundamental Films]] co-producing and distributing the titles.{{cite news|title='Transporter' sequels announced at Cannes Film Festival|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a483790/transporter-sequels-announced-at-cannes-film-festival.html|accessdate=24 July 2013|newspaper=digitalspy.co.uk|date=22 May 2013}}{{cite news|title=Cannes 2013: Three New Films In The Transporter Franchise Announced|url=http://www.empireonline.com/news/story.asp?NID=37600|accessdate=24 July 2013|newspaper=empireonline.com|date=22 May 2013}} The films will likely be budgeted between $30 million to $40 million each and at least one will be shot in China.{{cite news|title=New Transporter trilogy bound for big screen with parts 4 5 and 6 announced|url=http://metro.co.uk/2013/05/22/new-transporter-trilogy-bound-for-big-screen-with-parts-4-5-and-6-announced-3805144/|accessdate=24 July 2013|newspaper=metro.co.uk|date=22 May 2013}} [[Luc Besson]] will co-finance, distribute, produce and write all the films.{{cite news|title=Sequel Bits: ‘Transformers 4’, ‘Expendables 3’, ‘Transporter 4-6’, ‘The Hobbit’, ‘Anchorman 2’, ‘Pacific Rim 2’|url=http://www.slashfilm.com/sequel-bits-transformers-4-expendables-3-transporter-4-6-the-hobbit-anchorman-2-pacific-rim-2/|accessdate=24 July 2013|newspaper=slashfilm.com|date=21 May 2013}} English actor [[Ed Skrein]] replaced Jason Statham as Frank Martin on the fourth installment of the series.{{cite news|title=Transporter 4 will star Ed Skrein in Jason Statham role|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2014/feb/10/transporter-4-ed-skrein-jason-statham-game-of-thrones|accessdate=15 February 2014|newspaper=theguardian.com|date=10 February 2014}} The fourth film, ''[[The Transporter Refueled]]'', was released in the United States on 4 September 2015 with [[Camille Delamarre]] directing. ==Television== ===''Transporter: The Series''=== {{Main|Transporter: The Series}} ''Transporter: The Series'' is a television series based on the Transporter films which premiered in 2012 on 11 October in Germany on RTL, and on 6 December in France on M6. [[Chris Vance (actor)|Chris Vance]] took over the role of Frank from [[Jason Statham]] and was joined by Hungarian actress [[Andrea Osvárt]], who played Carla, the leading female role in the series,{{cite news |title= Cinemax's 'Transporter' Series Casts Male & Female Leads|first=Nellie |last=Andreeva |url=http://www.deadline.com/2011/05/cinemaxs-transporter-series-casts-male-female-lead/ |newspaper=[[Deadline Hollywood]] |date=20 May 2011}} starring as a former Intelligence agent who organises his missions, and French actor [[François Berléand]], the only returning actor from the film series, who reprised his role as Inspector Tarconi.{{cite news |title= 'Transporter': 'Lost's' Stephen Williams to Helm Pilot (Exclusive)|first=Lesley |last=Goldberg |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/transporter-losts-stephen-williams-helm-205186 |newspaper=[[The Hollywood Reporter]] |location=Los Angeles, California |date=23 June 2011}} The show was initially supposed to premiere on the cable network Cinemax but Cinemax pulled out due to production problems. TNT picked up the show and aired the 12-episode first season on the TNT network. TNT also ordered a 12-episode second season which aired in the autumn of 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/miptv-transporter-series-reboot-tnt-694443 |title=MIPTV: 'Transporter' Series Reboot for TNT Heavy on Action |work=The Hollywood Reporter |date=8 April 2014 |first=Scott |last=Roxborough |accessdate=21 December 2014}} ==Cast and characters== {| class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" width=99% ! rowspan="3" width="19%" | Character ! colspan="4" align="center" | Film ! style="text-align:center;"| TV series |- ! align="center" width="15%" | ''[[The Transporter]]'' ! align="center" width="15%" | ''[[Transporter 2]]'' ! align="center" width="15%" | ''[[Transporter 3]]'' ! align="center" width="15%" | ''[[The Transporter Refueled]]'' ! align="center" width="15%" | ''[[Transporter: The Series]]'' |- |{{small|'''2002'''}} |{{small|'''2005'''}} |{{small|'''2008'''}} |{{small|'''2015'''}} |{{small|'''2012-2014'''}} |- ! Caterina Boldieu | colspan="4" style="background:lightgrey;" |   | colspan="1" |[[Violante Placido]] |} ==Frank Martin== {{Main | Frank Martin (Transporter) }} '''Frank Martin''' is the [[protagonist]] of the films and television series. He initially serves as a [[reluctant hero]]. He is portrayed as a former [[Special Forces]] operative who was a team leader of a search and destroy unit. His military background includes operations "in and out of" [[Lebanon]], [[Syria]] and [[Sudan]]. He retires from this after becoming fatigued and disenchanted with his superior officers. In simple terms, he got tired of seeing his best efforts turned to nothing by the same people paying him to do the job. So he puts his skills to action as a private driver for hire. ==Reception== ===Box office=== {| class="wikitable sortable" width=99% border="1" style="text-align: center;" ! rowspan="2"| Film ! rowspan="2"| Release date ! colspan="3"| Box office gross ! colspan="2" text="wrap"| Box office ranking ! rowspan="2"| Budget ! rowspan="2"| {{nowrap|{{Abbr|Ref(s)|References}}}} |- ! Raja Pandit | country = India | language = [[Hindi]] | num_seasons = 2 | num_episodes = 24 | list_episodes = | executive_producer = Mehboob Ansari | producer = Vikram Bhatt | editor = | location = [[Mumbai]] | cinematography = | camera = [[Multiple-camera setup|Multi-Camara]] | runtime =20- 25 min minutes approx | company = VB On The Web | distributor = Jio Cinema | network = [[Jio Cinema (streaming media)|Jio Cinema]]
[[YouTube]] | picture_format = [[HDTV]] | audio_format = [[Dolby Digital]] | first_aired = 30 March 2017 | last_aired = present | related = | website = https://www.jiocinema.com/watch/tv/twisted-2/1/1/1524665557617/0/1524665557617 | website_title = Jio Cinema | production_website = http://loneranger.in/ | production_website_title = Lone Ranger Productions }} '''''Twisted ''''' is an Indian erotic thriller web series which premiered on 30 March 2017 and streaming on [[Jio Cinema (streaming media)|Jio Cinema]] as well as ''VB on the Web'' App. The show primarily stars [[Nia Sharma]]{{Cite web |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/television/what-s-hot/story/twisted-2-this-is-when-nia-sharma-s-new-web-series-will-start-streaming-1193393-2018-03-20 |title=Twisted 2: This is when Nia Sharma's new web series will start streaming |date=20 March 2018 |website=India Today |access-date=2018-06-24}}, Namit Khanna ,Rrahul Sudhir,[[Tia Bajpai]] in Season 1 and in season 2 it stars [[Nia Sharma]],Rrahul Sudhir and [[Dilnaz Irani]]. It is produced and written by [[Vikram Bhatt]] and director by Anupam Santosh Saroj. Vikram Bhatt's daughter, Krishna Bhatt is the Creative Director for the series. == Plot == Twisted Season 1 starts with the murder of Naina Raichand, wife of Ranbir Raichand. CID Officers Aryan Mathur and Disha Aggarwal have shortlisted the suspects to Ranbir Raichand and supermodel Aliyah Mukerjee, who is Ranbir's mistress. The rest of the season deals with Ranbir and Aliyah's version of their story and the search for Naina's true murderer. Twisted Season 2 takes off a few years after Season 1 had ended. Aliyah Mukherjee is framed in the murder of her boyfriend Vinod. It is later revealed that Aryan, who has wasted his life trying to nab Aliyah for the murders has now gone rogue. He plans to beat Aliyah at her own game and thus starts the game of love, hate, and murders between the two. Both are determined to win the game at whatever cost necessary. == Cast == Season 1 * [[Nia Sharma]] as Aliyah Mukerjee * Namit Khanna as Ranbir Raichand * Rahul Sudhir as Aryan Mathur * [[Tia Bajpai]] as Disha Agarwal Season 2 * [[Nia Sharma]] as Aliyah Mukherjee * Rahul Sudhir as Aryan Mathur * [[Dilnaz Irani]] as Arunima ==References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [https://www.mid-day.com/articles/trailer-of-vikram-bhatts-twisted-2-takes-boldness-to-a-new-level/19353186 Trailer Of Vikram Bhatt's Twisted 2 Takes Boldness To A New Level] * [http://indianexpress.com/article/entertainment/web-series/dilnaz-irani-police-officer-vikram-bhatt-twisted-2-5114633/ Dilnaz Irani to play a police officer in Vikram Bhatt’s web series Twisted 2] * [https://www.pinkvilla.com/tv/videos/twisted-season-2-nia-sharma-and-rahul-raj-indulge-some-romantic-conversation-promo-407636 Twisted Season 2: Nia Sharma and Rahul Raj indulge in some romantic conversation in this promo] [[Category:Indian web series]] [[Category:Hindi-language web series]] [[Category:YouTube series]] [[Category:2017 web series debuts]]

{{Infobox zoo |zoo_name=Ueno Zoo |logo= |logo_width= |logo_caption= |image=Ueno Zoo 2012.JPG |image_caption=Ueno Zoo entrance gate |image_width=250px |date_opened=1882 |location=[[Tokyo]], [[Japan]] |area={{Convert|14.3|ha|abbr=on}} |coordinates={{Coord|35|43|03|N|139|46|17|E|display=it|region:JP-13_type:landmark_source:dewiki}} |num_species=464 |publictransit= {{rint|jp|jre|size=20}} [[Keihin-Tohoku Line|{{jrls|JK|link=Keihin-Tohoku Line}}]] [[Yamanote Line|{{jrls|JY|link=Yamanote Line}}]] [[Utsunomiya Line|{{jrls|JU|}}]] [[Joban Line|{{jrls|JJ|link=Joban Line}}]] at {{STN|Ueno}}
{{rint|tokyo|metro|size=20}} {{rint|tokyo|g|size=20}} {{rint|tokyo|h|size=20}} at {{STN|Ueno}}
{{rint|tokyo|metro|size=20}} {{rint|tokyo|c|size=20}} at {{STN|Nezu}}
{{rint|tokyo|keisei|size=20}} at {{STN|Keisei Ueno}} |num_animals=2600 |exhibits = [[giant panda]], [[Sumatran tiger]], [[western lowland gorilla]] |members=[[Japanese Association of Zoos and Aquariums|JAZA]] }} The {{nihongo|'''Ueno Zoo'''|恩賜上野動物園|Onshi Ueno Dōbutsuen}} is a {{Convert|14.3|ha|sing=on}} [[zoo]], managed by the [[Tokyo Metropolitan Government]], and located in [[Taitō, Tokyo]], [[Japan]]. It is Japan's oldest zoo, opening on March 20, 1882. It is a five-minute walk from the Park Exit of [[Ueno Station]], with convenient access from Tokyo's public-transportation network. The [[Ueno Zoo Monorail]], the first [[monorail]] in the country, connects the eastern and western parts of the grounds. The zoo is in [[Ueno Park]], a large [[urban park]] that is home to museums, a small amusement park, and other attractions. The zoo is closed Mondays (Tuesday if Monday is a holiday). == History == The zoo started life as a menagerie attached to the National Museum of Natural History. In 1881, responsibility for this menagerie was handed to naturalist and civil servant [[Tanaka Yoshio]], who oversaw its transition into a public zoo.{{cite book|author=Mayumi Itoh|title=Japanese Wartime Zoo Policy: The Silent Victims of World War II|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=_arGAAAAQBAJ&pg=PA16|date=15 November 2010|publisher=Palgrave Macmillan|isbn=978-0-230-11744-0|pages=16–17}} The ground was originally estate of the imperial family, but was {{Nihongo|[[:wikt:bestowal|bestow]]ed|恩賜|onshi|forming the first part of the name in Japanese, untranslated officially}} to the municipal government in 1924 — along with [[Ueno Park]] — on the occasion of crown prince [[Hirohito]]'s wedding.{{citation |last1= Kawata |first1=Ken| editor1-last=Kisling | editor1-first=Vernon N. | year=2001 | title=Zoo and Aquarium History: Ancient Animal Collections to Zoological Gardens | publisher=CRC Press | isbn=978-0-8493-2100-9 | chapter =Zoos of Japan | page=298 }} === World War II === In August 1943, the administrator of Tokyo, [[Shigeo Ōdachi]], ordered that all "wild and dangerous animals" at the zoo be killed, claiming that bombs could hit the zoo and escaping wild animals would wreak havoc in the streets of Tokyo. Requests by the staff at the zoo for a reprieve, or to evacuate the animals elsewhere, were refused. The animals were executed primarily by poisoning, strangulation or by simply placing the animals on starvation diets. A memorial service was held for the animals in September 1943 (while two of the elephants were still starving) and a permanent memorial (built anew in 1975) can be found in the Ueno Zoo.[http://japanfocus.org/-Frederick_S_-Litten/3225 Starving the Elephants - The Slaughter of Animals in Wartime Tokyo's Ueno Zoo] Shortly after the March 1945 bombings of Tokyo, the Japanese placed U.S. Army Air Force navigator and bombardier Ray "Hap" Halloran on display naked in a Ueno Zoo tiger cage so civilians could walk in front of the cage and view the B-29 prisoner.[http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20080430w1.html War trauma leads to efforts to reconcile | The Japan Times Online] Article dated Wednesday, April 30, 2008 (Retrieved on June 28, 2009)[http://www.haphalloran.com/autobiography.asp The Autobiography of Raymond "Hap" Halloran] === Recent renovations === The zoo provides animals an environment similar to the natural habitat. In recent years, the old-fashioned cages of the past have been replaced with modern habitats, such as the "Gorilla Woods," built after two well-publicized mishaps in 1999.[http://www.aapn.org/japanesegorillas.html The Controversy over the Value of Zoo Animals Two Stories about Gorillas in a Japanese Zoo and What They Mean] == Animal population == [[File:Seals ueno.jpg|thumb|California sea lions sleeping]] [[File:Llama at ueno.jpg|thumb|Llama]] The zoo is home to more than 3,000 individuals representing over 400 species. The [[Sumatran tiger]], and [[western lowland gorilla]] head the list of the zoo's population. Ueno has more species on exhibition than any other zoo in Japan. The zoo is also home to [[zebra]]s, [[Japanese macaque]]s, [[red-crowned crane]]s, [[white-tailed eagle]]s and [[king penguin]]s, along with [[goat]]s, [[sheep]], [[pig]]s, [[llama]]s, [[ostrich]]es, and [[rabbit]]s. At some point, redistribution of the animals among Tokyo's other zoos (including [[Tama Zoo]] and [[Inokashira Nature Park]]) left Ueno without a lion. However, in response to public demand, Ueno borrowed a female from the Yokohama Municipal Zoo. {{Citation needed|date=November 2008}} === Principal animals === [[Image:UenoGorilla.jpg|thumb|Western lowland gorilla at the Ueno Zoo]] [[File:Giant Panda in Ueno Zoo.JPG|thumb|Giant panda at Ueno Zoo]] After the death of [[Giant panda]] [[Ling Ling (giant panda)|Ling Ling]] in 2008, Ueno Zoo was without a member of this species for the first time since 1972.[http://search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20080501a3.html Giant panda Ling Ling dies at Ueno Zoo], Kyodo News, [[Japan Times]], 2008 Two new giant pandas arrived from the Chinese [[Wolong Nature Reserve]] in February 2011. The male panda, Billy (比力 ビーリー) was renamed in Ueno to Līlī (力力 リーリー) to emphasize his playful vitality. The female's name Siennyu (仙女 シィエンニュ ‘Fairy’) was changed to Shinshin (真真 シンシン), referring to purity (純真) and innocence (天真).{{ja icon}} [http://www.ueno-panda.jp/press The Ueno Pandas' Profiles], Ueno Zoo, 2011{{zh icon}} [[Foreign relations of Japan|PRC Embassy in Japan]], [http://big5.fmprc.gov.cn/gate/big5/jp.china-embassy.org/chn/zrdt/t801184.htm 大熊貓"比力、仙女"抵東京] (Giant Pandas Bili & Xiannü Arrived at Tokyo) The new names were based on a public poll. The final choices picked by the zoo were, however, not among top choices.{{ja icon}} [http://www.ueno-panda.jp/topics/detail.html?id=20 ジャイアントパンダの名前が決まりました] (Panda's Names Have Been Decided) [[Reduplication#Chinese|Reduplication]] is very common in [[List of giant pandas|panda names]]. Other animals housed at the zoo include [[Asiatic lion]]s, [[Polar bear]]s, [[Asian elephant]]s, [[gorilla]]s, [[Reticulated giraffe]]s, [[Sumatran tiger]]s, [[otter]]s, [[red fox]]es, [[bat]]s, [[toucan]]s, [[tapir]]s, [[kangaroo]]s, [[California sea lion]]s, [[koala]]s, [[penguin]]s, [[sun bear]]s, [[flamingo]]s, [[pangolin]]s, [[slow loris]]es, [[southern three-banded armadillo]]s, [[fennec fox]]es, [[pygmy hippopotamus|pygmy hippo]]s, [[hippopotamus|hippo]]s, [[okapi]]s, [[anteater]]s, [[crocodile]]s, [[turtle]]s, [[lemur]]s, [[pelican]]s, [[puffin]]s and [[black rhinoceros]]es. ==See also== *''[[Faithful Elephants]]'', story of the elephants in the zoo during World War II * [[Tama Zoological Park]] ==References== {{reflist |refs= {{Cite web |url=http://www.tokyo-zoo.net/english/ueno/main.html |title=About Ueno Zoo |work=tokyo-zoo.net |publisher=Tokyo Zoological Park Society |accessdate=16 April 2011 }} {{ZooOrg|jaza|zoos|accessdate=5 March 2011}} }} ==Further reading== *Itoh, Mayumi (2010). ''Japanese Wartime Zoo Policy: The Silent Victims of World War II''. Palgrave-MacMillan. {{ISBN|978-0230108943}}. ==External links== {{Commons category-inline}} * {{Official website|http://www.tokyo-zoo.net/english/ueno/index.html}} [[Category:Ueno Park]] [[Category:Tourist attractions in Tokyo]] [[Category:Zoos in Japan]] [[Category:1882 establishments in Japan]] [[Category:Zoos established in 1882]]

{{distinguish|Zumba|Samba}} [[File:Zambita.jpg|right|thumb| An Argentine couple dancing Zamba in the streets of [[Buenos Aires]] as a show for tourists.]] '''Zamba''' is a traditional dance of [[Argentina]]. It is a style of [[Music of Argentina|Argentine music]] and Argentine folk dance. Zamba is very different from its [[homophone]], the [[samba]] - musically, rhythmically, temperamentally, in the steps of the dance and in its costume. It has six beats to the bar and is a majestic dance, performed by couples who circle each other waving white [[handkerchief]]s very elegantly. It has common elements with the [[cueca]].
Zambas are composed about every genre, from those that celebrate people or events of [[History of Argentina|Argentine history]], to those that describe the beauty of a region, or of its women. There are zambas of political protest, and even one called ''[[Aerolíneas Argentinas]]''. The ''[[bombo legüero]]'' drum is prominent in the playing of the zamba.
==Name and Origin== The name "zamba" refers to a colonial term for [[zambo]] (people that are descendants of [[Amerindian]] and [[Ethnic groups of Africa|African people]]). It is therefore called zamba because its lyrical content was aimed at its native listeners.
The dance originated in the Argentine province of Salta in the Creole genre known as the zamacueca of [[Peru]], in 1824 at the same time that [[Peru]], under [[José de San Martín]], obtained independence. It came to Argentina through "Alto Peru," a region that is modern day [[Bolivia]] and through Chile between 1825 and 1830.<ref>La primera descripcion coreográfica completa documentada de la zamacueca se encuentra en "Mefistófeles" año 1 Nº22 "Aires Nacionales" del folclorólogo Arturo Berrutti, publicado en Buenos Aires el 29 de julio de 1882; {{cite book | last = Berrutti | first = Arturo | title = Aires Nacionales | date = 29 July 1882 | publisher = Mefistófeles | language = Spanish }}</ref><ref>{{cite book | last = Aricó | first = Hector | title = Danzas Tradicionales Argentinas -Una Nueva Propuesta- | year = 2002 | publisher = Vilco SRL | isbn = 987-43-4537-3 | language = Spanish }}</ref>
==Description== The Zamba is a slow dance in three-quarter time played primarily on guitar and [[bombo legüero]]. The steps of the dance are a walking step, an alternate step (two steps at one time), and a tip toe alternate step or "sobrepaso punteado" (three steps at one time). The Zamba also requires a handkerchief.
==Today== Today Zamba is frequently danced in the streets of [[Argentina]] and always danced in [[Argentine]] folklore parties and festivals.It is performed during the national holidays of [[Argentina]].

{{Infobox VG series | title = Zeebo Extreme | image = | caption = | platform of origin = [[Zeebo]] | developer = [[Tectoy|Tectoy Digital]] | publisher = [[Tectoy]], [[Zeebo|Zeebo Inc.]] | genre = [[Sports game|Sport]] | spinoffs = }} '''''Zeebo Extreme''''' is a series of 3D racing videogames created for the [[Zeebo]] system.{{cite web|url=http://tecnologia.uol.com.br/ultnot/2009/02/27/ult530u6705.jhtm | title=Tectoy Digital libera vídeo de "Zeebo Extreme"; assista |publisher=UOL Technologia }} The games were developed by the [[Tec Toy|Tectoy Digital]] studio in [[Campinas]], [[Brazil]]. To date, five Zeebo Extreme games have been introduced in Brazil and four in Mexico. Each of the games involves a race over air, water or land in a particular type of vehicle, such as an airplane, [[Gravity racer|billy cart]] or jet board. In single player mode, the player competes against the game. In two-player mode, players race against each other. The games offer a variety of courses, levels of difficulty and [[power-up]]s.{{cite web |url=http://www.zeebo.com.br/games.aspx |title=Zeebo Brazil Games |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20091217135804/http://www.zeebo.com.br/games.aspx |archivedate=2009-12-17 |df= }} The games use either the standard Zeebo ''Z-Pad'' gamepad or the Boomerang control, a motion-sensitive controller similar to the [[Wii Remote]].http://www.zeebo.com.br/console.aspx#boomerang {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090918102156/http://www.zeebo.com.br/console.aspx |date=2009-09-18 }} ==Games== ===Released games=== {{Video game titles| {{Video game titles/item |article= Zeebo Extreme Rolimã |title= Zeebo Extreme Rolimã (Ruleman) |date= August 15, 2009 (Brazil)

December 7, 2009 (Mexico) |cancelado= |refs= |release= 2009 — Zeebo |plataform= [[Zeebo]] |notes= *The second game of the Extreme series, featuring airplane racing through various landscapes. }} {{Video game titles/item |article= Zeebo Extreme Baja |title= Zeebo Extreme Baja |date= October 31, 2009 (Brazil)
